questions.question: How do we control access to the PSPs at APS?
As long as we have access to one PSP, we can enter any PSP at APS

answers.r: No. Access to one does not mean access to all.

questions.question: What are some ways to violate PSP CIP requirements? (pick 3)

answers.a: Reporting that you forgot to badge in, so manual log entries can be made
answers.r: No, this would prevent a violation

answers.a: Using your badge to scan before entering a PSP
answers.r: No, this is what you SHOULD always do.

questions.question: What should you do if you accidentally tailgate or allow someone to tailgate you?

answers.r: Sorry, you can do this later

answers.a: Go back into the PSP, scanning twice
answers.r: Door systems don't work that way.

answers.a: Notify Security (so manual log entries can be created)
Leave a confession note on the PSP door

questions.question: What's your duty to keep the ESP secure?

answers.a: If a cable looks loose, plug it in
answers.r: No, don't touch it. Just report it.
